\n\t\t\t\t

Temporary Relocation of Route | 33rd & Dauphin Construction Project

\n\t\t\t\t

September 4, 2012 - January, 2014

\n\t\t\t\t

The 33rd & Dauphin Bus Loop will be under construction from September 4, 2012 until January 2014. During this time, Bus Routes 7, 39 & 54 will temporarily relocate to Cecil B. Moore Bus Loop located at 33rd St. & Cecil B. Moore Ave.

Bus Route 32 will remain on 33rd St. and Route 61 will remain on Ridge Ave. with new stop locations.

The sidewalks around 33rd & Dauphin Bus Loop will be closed to pedestrian traffic while the reconstruction work take splace.

At the completion of the project, customers will see:

\n

New bus berthing locations and passenger shelters

\n

Improvements to the historical building

\n

Improved lighting and signage

\n

Enhanced green space, landscaping, and an art installation

\n

Route 32

\n

Northbound to Ridge & Lyceum: New Stop on 33rd St. at Dauphin St.

Southbound to Broad & Carpenter: No Change

\n\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Route Detour

\n\t\t\t\t

Beginning Tuesday, December 6, 2011

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to the PennDOT Darby Creek Bridge Reconstruction Project and the partial closure of the span to traffic along Industrial Highway, all Route 37 buses traveling towards Broad and Snyder will be detoured from Industrial Highway (Rt. 291), via Stewart Ave, I-95 and Wanamaker Ave

\n

Limited service (towards Broad & Snyder) to hotels along Industrial Highway will be provided as follows:

\n

Five (5) daily trips will turn right from Wanamaker Ave and travel along Industrial Highway, enter the Ramada Inn parking lot, before turning around and resuming regular routing

\n

These limited service trips to the Ramada Inn will leave Chester Transportation Center:

\n

Weekdays - 6:30 a.m., 7:27 a.m., 8:17 a.m., 2:14 p.m. & 3:26 p.m.

\n

Saturdays - 6:05 a.m., 7:45 a.m., 8:35 a.m., 2:25 p.m. & 3:15 p.m.

\n

Sundays - 6:07 a.m., 7:47 a.m., 8:37 a.m., 2:25 p.m. & 3:15 p.m.

\n

All Route 37 customers should expect some in-service travel delays while this detour is in effect

\n

Detour routing map | PDF

\n\t\t\t\t

Effective Monday, January 14, 2013

\n\t\t\t\t

Beginning January 14, northbound Route 52 service will change as follows:

Trips ending at 54th St. & City Ave. will operate via Wynnefield Ave., Cardinal Ave., and City Ave. to reach their final destination at 54th St./City Ave.

The turnaround route currently operating on Belmont and Conshohocken Aves. will be permanently discontinued.

\n

Customers will not be able to board or exit northbound buses between 54th St./Wynnefield Ave. to Cardinal/City Aves. - the first stop on the new routing will be at Cardinal and City Aves.

\n

The 54th St. and Wynnefield Ave. stop has been discontinued

\n

The 54th St. and Overbrook Ave. stop will be discontinued for all northbound trips except those going to Gladwyne.

Please Note: Route 52 Gladwyne trips will continue to operate north on 54th St. to City Ave. then towards Gladwyne.

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

\n

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

\n

Service will operate around the construction with detours stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

\n

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

\n

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

\n

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour.

\n

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

\n

Summer Timetables go into effect on Sunday, June 17, 2012.

\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Temporary Service Changes

\n\t\t\t\t

Monday-Friday, October 29 - Until Further Notice | 9:00 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to track maintenance between Wynnewood Road and Bryn Mawr Stations, trains will run on a special schedule.

\n

To Norristown Transportation Center (from 69th Street Transportation Center)

\n

AM Trains will depart 69th St at 8:44, 8:58, 9:22, 9:42, 10:02, 10:22, 10:42, 11:02, 11:22 and 11:42 a.m.

\n

PM Trains will depart 69th St at 12:02, 12:22, 12:42, 1:02, 1:22, 1:42, 2:02, 2:22, 2:42 and 3:02 p.m.

\n

Scheduled service follows the September 3, 2012 printed schedule starting with the 3:05 p.m. trip to Hughes Park

\n

To 69th Street Transportation Center (from Norristown Transportation Center)

\n

AM Trains will depart NTC at 8:58, 9:18, 9:38, 9:58, 10:18, 10:38, 10:58, 11:18, 11:38 and 11:58

\n

PM Trains will depart NTC at 12:18, 12:38, 12:58, 1:18, 1:38, 1:58, 2:18, 2:40 and 3:00 p.m.

\n

Scheduled service follows the September 3, 2012 printed schedule starting with the 3:20 p.m. trip to 69th St.

Boarding Location Change

All trains will board from the Outbound platform (towards NTC) at Bryn Mawr, Haverford, Ardmore Avenue and Ardmore Junction Stations

Customers boarding trains going towards NTC and 69th St. should allow extra time as a result of the schedule adjustments and in-service delays through the work area.

\n\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Train Boarding Tips During 69th St. Platform Reconstruction Work - Phase 2

\n\t\t\t\t

Monday through Friday beginning September 17, 2012 | 8 p.m. - 4 a.m.

\n\t\t\t\t

As part of the station improvement program for the Norristown High Speed Line, reconstruction work to replace the platforms at 69th St. Transportation Center will require some changes to boarding procedures:

\n

This work will continue for approximately one (1) year and will take place in four (4) phases:

\n

Phase 1 Work

\n

Completed.

\n

Phase 2 Work

\n

Platform 3 will be out of service for demolition and reconstruction

\n

Platform 4 trains will load and unload on Platform 4

\n

Platform 3 trains will load and unload on Platform 2

\n

To allow customers to safely exit and board trains, please wait in the lobby area until the arriving train is unloaded

\n

SEPTA personnel will be available to assist customers and provide directions to the correct boarding platform

\n

To ensure your safety, please be alert for construction barricades and active work areas

\n\t\t\t

", "advisory_message": "
\n\t\t\t\t

Weekend Bus Substitution

\n\t\t\t\t

Saturday & Sunday, March 23 & 24, 2013

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to track and signal work along SEPTA's Manayunk/Norristown Regional Rail Line, shuttle buses will replace rail service between Elm Street Station and Wissahickon Station on Saturday and Sunday, March 23 and 24.

\n

Passengers traveling inbound to Center City will board shuttle buses at Elm Street Station 32 minutes before their regularly scheduled train times. After leaving Elm Street Station, shuttle buses will stop at Main Street, Norristown Transportation Center, Conshohocken and Spring Mill Stations before expressing to Wissahickon Station.

\n

Shuttle buses will not serve Miquon, Manayunk or Ivy Ridge Stations. Inbound passengers traveling to Manayunk or Ivy Ridge Stations will transfer from shuttle buses to outbound trains at Wissahickon Station.

\n

During bus substitution weekends, there will be no train or shuttle bus service to or from Miquon Station. Customers who normally utilize Miquon Station are advised to use Spring Mill Station instead.

\n

Outbound Manayunk/Norristown Regional Rail Line trains will operate as far as Ivy Ridge Station. Passengers traveling to Norristown will board shuttle buses at Wissahickon Station to complete their outbound trips. Shuttle buses will express from Wissahickon Station to Spring Mill Station before stopping at Conshohocken, Norristown Transportation Center, Main Street and Elm Street Stations.

\n

All trains will arrive and depart from Wissahickon Train Station at regularly scheduled times. Passengers should add approximately 32 minutes onto their trips.

\n

Inbound trains will depart Ivy Ridge Station 10 minutes earlier than the current schedule.

\n

Saturday Late Night Supplemental Inbound Service:

\n

On Saturday evenings during bus substitution weekends, supplemental late night bus service will be provided for inbound passengers traveling between Elm Street and Manayunk Station.

\n

Four bus trips will leave the Elm Street Station at regularly scheduled train times of trains 235 (9:37 p.m.), 2573 (10:45 p.m.), 6239 (11:37 p.m.) and 6241 (12:37 a.m.). After leaving the Elm Street Station, the shuttle buses will serve Main Street, Norristown Transportation Center, Spring Mill and Manayunk Stations.

\n

Saturday Late Night Supplemental Outbound Service:

\n

On Saturday evenings during bus substitution weekends, supplemental late night bus service will be provided for outbound passengers traveling between Manayunk and Elm Street Stations.

\n

Two bus trips will leave Manayunk Station at the regularly scheduled train times of trains 6236 (1:09 a.m.) and 6238 (2:09 a.m.). After leaving the Manayunk Station, the outbound shuttle buses will travel to Spring Mill, Conshohocken, Norristown Transportation Center, Main Street and Elm Street Stations.

\n

Saturday Shuttle Bus Schedule | PDF
Sunday Shuttle Bus Schedule | PDF

\n\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to track work, accessible service options will change for customers at Elm Street and Spring Mill Stations.

\n

ADA riders will board a van to/from the above locations as follows:

\n

Inbound To Center City

\n

Board shuttle bus to Wissahickon Station. Board ADA van from Wissahickon to Temple University. Board any train from Temple University to Center City Philadelphia.

\n

Outbound To Spring Mill or Elm Street

\n

Board any train to Temple University. Board ADA van at Temple University for Spring Mill or Elm Street.

\n

Note: Inbound shuttle buses will depart Elm Street and Spring Mill 32 minutes earlier than regularly scheduled train time.

\n\t\t\t\t

Tips for Stress Free Travel at Cornwell Heights Station

\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

All SEPTA Regional Rail trains operate according to a published timetable but many customers don't realize the scheduled the times are when the train DEPARTS the station.

\n

For your safety and to help us maintain our On-Time performance goals, it's essential that you factor this in to your travel planning so that you have plenty of time to:

\n

Get to the Station parking lot

\n

Catch the Shuttle

\n

Buy your ticket or pass if necessary

\n

Arrive at the Station platform before the train arrives

\n

We know mornings can be hectic, but you can't cut corners when it comes to travel safety. We're concerned about the number of Regional Rail customers sprinting for a train that's already at the station and the complaints we sometimes receive that the Conductor saw you and refused to wait \"just another minute\" to let you on the train. It's important to understand they're not trying to be discourteous - we simply can't do it for you (and everyone else) and maintain our travel schedule and keep riders safe by discouraging them from running for trains.

\n

Public transit is a partnership between SEPTA and our customers. Our goal is to ensure the highest levels service and on time performance possible. In return we ask that you plan your trip to arrive at the station in enough time so that you can catch the Shuttle and be waiting on the platform when the train pulls in.

\n\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Shuttle Bus Service Continues East of Frankford Ave

\n

With the completion of the initial phase of the PennDOT demolition work for the I-95 reconstruction project, trolley service will return on the Route 15 for the portion of the line operating between 63rd & Girard and Frankford & Delaware Avenues (Northern Liberties Loop)

\n

Customers wishing to travel east of Frankford Ave will board the connecting shuttle bus service at Front Street - by the Girard Ave stop on the Market Frankford Line

Service Detours

\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

\n

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

\n

\n

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

\n

\n

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

\n

Summer Timetables go into effect on Sunday, June 17, 2012.

Service will continue to operate along Moyamensing Ave., Pattison Ave., and Broad St. before getting on I-95.

\n

Routing through Penrose Industrial Park will change as noted below.

\n

To Broad St./Oregon Ave.

\n

Service will operate from Island Ave via Enterprise Ave. before getting on I-95.

\n

Routing through the Penrose Industrial Park will change as noted below.

\n

Penrose Industrial Park Routing Change

\n

Due to traffic safety concerns the routing at Penrose Industrial Park will change as follows:

\n

The 3 current bus stops on Escort & Executive Aves. will ONLY serve trips going towards UPS.

\n

Trips towards Broad & Oregon will stop along Island & Enterprise Aves. at Island & Escort Aves., and Enterprise & Executive Aves.

\n

Route 68 Detour Map | PDF

\n

The Platt Bridge reconstruction work is expected to last for approximately 2 years. Route 68 Local service will remain on detour during this time; Express service will not be impacted by the detour.

\n\t\t\t\t

40th Street Bridge Reopening - Regular Route 38 & 40 Routing Resumes

\n\t\t\t\t

Effective Sunday, November 25, 2012

\n\t\t\t\t

With the re-opening of the 40th Street bridge over Amtrak, Route 38 and Route 40 service changes will be as follows:

\n

Route 38

\n

Route 38 will resume its regular routing via 40th Street.

\n

Route 38 Map | PDF

\n

Route 40

\n

Eastbound service will return to its regular routing via 40th Street.

\n

Westbound service will continue its present detour around the closed 41st Street bridge via Left on Mantua Avenue, Right on 42nd Street, Right on Girard Avenue and Left on 41st Street where it will resume its regular route.

\n

Route 40 Map | PDF

\n

We wish to thank you for your patience during this City of Philadelphia construction project; these changes are expected to reduce overall travel time and improve the on-time performance for these routes.

\n

Timetable maps on the SEPTA website will be revised to show the changes, however new paper timetables will not be issued until the February 17, 2013 schedule change.

\n\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Route Detour

\n\t\t\t\t

Beginning Tuesday, December 6, 2011

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to the PennDOT Darby Creek Bridge Reconstruction Project and the partial closure of the span to traffic along Industrial Highway, all Route 37 buses traveling towards Broad and Snyder will be detoured from Industrial Highway (Rt. 291), via Stewart Ave, I-95 and Wanamaker Ave

\n

Limited service (towards Broad & Snyder) to hotels along Industrial Highway will be provided as follows:

\n

Five (5) daily trips will turn right from Wanamaker Ave and travel along Industrial Highway, enter the Ramada Inn parking lot, before turning around and resuming regular routing

\n

These limited service trips to the Ramada Inn will leave Chester Transportation Center:

\n

Weekdays - 6:30 a.m., 7:27 a.m., 8:17 a.m., 2:14 p.m. & 3:26 p.m.

\n

Saturdays - 6:05 a.m., 7:45 a.m., 8:35 a.m., 2:25 p.m. & 3:15 p.m.

\n

Sundays - 6:07 a.m., 7:47 a.m., 8:37 a.m., 2:25 p.m. & 3:15 p.m.

\n

All Route 37 customers should expect some in-service travel delays while this detour is in effect

\n

Detour routing map | PDF

Trips ending at 54th St. & City Ave. will operate via Wynnefield Ave., Cardinal Ave., and City Ave. to reach their final destination at 54th St./City Ave.

\n

The 54th St. and Overbrook Ave. stop will be discontinued for all northbound trips except those going to Gladwyne.

\n\t\t\t\t

Temporary Relocation of Route | 33rd & Dauphin Construction Project

\n\t\t\t\t

September 4, 2012 - January, 2014

\n\t\t\t\t

The 33rd & Dauphin Bus Loop will be under construction from September 4, 2012 until January 2014. During this time, Bus Routes 7, 39 & 54 will temporarily relocate to Cecil B. Moore Bus Loop located at 33rd St. & Cecil B. Moore Ave.

Bus Route 32 will remain on 33rd St. and Route 61 will remain on Ridge Ave. with new stop locations.

The sidewalks around 33rd & Dauphin Bus Loop will be closed to pedestrian traffic while the reconstruction work take splace.

At the completion of the project, customers will see:

\n

New bus berthing locations and passenger shelters

\n

Improvements to the historical building

\n

Improved lighting and signage

\n

Enhanced green space, landscaping, and an art installation

\n

Route 7

\n

Northbound to 33rd & Dauphin: Last stop will be 33rd & Dauphin. Operators will make stops for customers boarding and exiting along 33rd St. to Cecil B. Moore Ave. New Stop on 33rd St. at Dauphin St.

Southbound to Whitman Plaza: Buses will stop at 33rd & Cecil B. Moore Loop. New stop on Dauphin St. at Ridge Ave.

\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Temporary Service Changes

\n\t\t\t\t

Monday-Friday, October 29 - Until Further Notice | 9:00 a.m. - 2:30 p.m.

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to track maintenance between Wynnewood Road and Bryn Mawr Stations, trains will run on a special schedule.

\n

To Norristown Transportation Center (from 69th Street Transportation Center)

\n

AM Trains will depart 69th St at 8:44, 8:58, 9:22, 9:42, 10:02, 10:22, 10:42, 11:02, 11:22 and 11:42 a.m.

\n

PM Trains will depart 69th St at 12:02, 12:22, 12:42, 1:02, 1:22, 1:42, 2:02, 2:22, 2:42 and 3:02 p.m.

\n

Scheduled service follows the September 3, 2012 printed schedule starting with the 3:05 p.m. trip to Hughes Park

\n

To 69th Street Transportation Center (from Norristown Transportation Center)

\n

AM Trains will depart NTC at 8:58, 9:18, 9:38, 9:58, 10:18, 10:38, 10:58, 11:18, 11:38 and 11:58

\n

PM Trains will depart NTC at 12:18, 12:38, 12:58, 1:18, 1:38, 1:58, 2:18, 2:40 and 3:00 p.m.

\n

Scheduled service follows the September 3, 2012 printed schedule starting with the 3:20 p.m. trip to 69th St.

Boarding Location Change

All trains will board from the Outbound platform (towards NTC) at Bryn Mawr, Haverford, Ardmore Avenue and Ardmore Junction Stations

Customers boarding trains going towards NTC and 69th St. should allow extra time as a result of the schedule adjustments and in-service delays through the work area.

\n\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t

Train Boarding Tips During 69th St. Platform Reconstruction Work - Phase 2

\n\t\t\t\t

Monday through Friday beginning September 17, 2012 | 8 p.m. - 4 a.m.

\n\t\t\t\t

As part of the station improvement program for the Norristown High Speed Line, reconstruction work to replace the platforms at 69th St. Transportation Center will require some changes to boarding procedures:

\n

This work will continue for approximately one (1) year and will take place in four (4) phases:

\n

Phase 1 Work

\n

Completed.

\n

Phase 2 Work

\n

Platform 3 will be out of service for demolition and reconstruction

\n

Platform 4 trains will load and unload on Platform 4

\n

Platform 3 trains will load and unload on Platform 2

\n

To allow customers to safely exit and board trains, please wait in the lobby area until the arriving train is unloaded

\n

SEPTA personnel will be available to assist customers and provide directions to the correct boarding platform

\n

To ensure your safety, please be alert for construction barricades and active work areas

\n\t\t\t

", "advisory_message": "
\n\t\t\t\t

Weekend Bus Substitution

\n\t\t\t\t

Saturday & Sunday, March 23 & 24, 2013

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to track and signal work along SEPTA's Manayunk/Norristown Regional Rail Line, shuttle buses will replace rail service between Elm Street Station and Wissahickon Station on Saturday and Sunday, March 23 and 24.

\n

Passengers traveling inbound to Center City will board shuttle buses at Elm Street Station 32 minutes before their regularly scheduled train times. After leaving Elm Street Station, shuttle buses will stop at Main Street, Norristown Transportation Center, Conshohocken and Spring Mill Stations before expressing to Wissahickon Station.

\n

Shuttle buses will not serve Miquon, Manayunk or Ivy Ridge Stations. Inbound passengers traveling to Manayunk or Ivy Ridge Stations will transfer from shuttle buses to outbound trains at Wissahickon Station.

\n

During bus substitution weekends, there will be no train or shuttle bus service to or from Miquon Station. Customers who normally utilize Miquon Station are advised to use Spring Mill Station instead.

\n

Outbound Manayunk/Norristown Regional Rail Line trains will operate as far as Ivy Ridge Station. Passengers traveling to Norristown will board shuttle buses at Wissahickon Station to complete their outbound trips. Shuttle buses will express from Wissahickon Station to Spring Mill Station before stopping at Conshohocken, Norristown Transportation Center, Main Street and Elm Street Stations.

\n

All trains will arrive and depart from Wissahickon Train Station at regularly scheduled times. Passengers should add approximately 32 minutes onto their trips.

\n

Inbound trains will depart Ivy Ridge Station 10 minutes earlier than the current schedule.

\n

Saturday Late Night Supplemental Inbound Service:

\n

On Saturday evenings during bus substitution weekends, supplemental late night bus service will be provided for inbound passengers traveling between Elm Street and Manayunk Station.

\n

Four bus trips will leave the Elm Street Station at regularly scheduled train times of trains 235 (9:37 p.m.), 2573 (10:45 p.m.), 6239 (11:37 p.m.) and 6241 (12:37 a.m.). After leaving the Elm Street Station, the shuttle buses will serve Main Street, Norristown Transportation Center, Spring Mill and Manayunk Stations.

\n

Saturday Late Night Supplemental Outbound Service:

\n

On Saturday evenings during bus substitution weekends, supplemental late night bus service will be provided for outbound passengers traveling between Manayunk and Elm Street Stations.

\n

Two bus trips will leave Manayunk Station at the regularly scheduled train times of trains 6236 (1:09 a.m.) and 6238 (2:09 a.m.). \n\t\t\t\t

Tips for Stress Free Travel at Cornwell Heights Station

\n\t\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

All SEPTA Regional Rail trains operate according to a published timetable but many customers don't realize the scheduled the times are when the train DEPARTS the station.

\n

For your safety and to help us maintain our On-Time performance goals, it's essential that you factor this in to your travel planning so that you have plenty of time to:

\n

Get to the Station parking lot

\n

Catch the Shuttle

\n

Buy your ticket or pass if necessary

\n

Arrive at the Station platform before the train arrives

\n

We know mornings can be hectic, but you can't cut corners when it comes to travel safety. We're concerned about the number of Regional Rail customers sprinting for a train that's already at the station and the complaints we sometimes receive that the Conductor saw you and refused to wait \"just another minute\" to let you on the train. It's important to understand they're not trying to be discourteous - we simply can't do it for you (and everyone else) and maintain our travel schedule and keep riders safe by discouraging them from running for trains.

\n

Public transit is a partnership between SEPTA and our customers. Our goal is to ensure the highest levels service and on time performance possible. In return we ask that you plan your trip to arrive at the station in enough time so that you can catch the Shuttle and be waiting on the platform when the train pulls in.

\n\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

Detour | George C. Platt Memorial Bridge Construction

\n\t\t\t\t

Beginning Sunday, June 3, 2012

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to PennDOT construction on the George C. Platt Memorial Bridge, Route 68 Local service will be detoured via I-95. Service frequency will remain the same during the detour period and all existing trips to/from the Tastykake Bakery will not be affected.

Local Routing Detour

\n

To UPS

\n

Service will continue to operate along Moyamensing Ave., Pattison Ave., and Broad St. before getting on I-95.

\n

Routing through Penrose Industrial Park will change as noted below.

\n

To Broad St./Oregon Ave.

\n

Service will operate from Island Ave via Enterprise Ave. before getting on I-95.

\n

Routing through the Penrose Industrial Park will change as noted below.

\n

Penrose Industrial Park Routing Change

\n

Due to traffic safety concerns the routing at Penrose Industrial Park will change as follows:

\n

The 3 current bus stops on Escort & Executive Aves. will ONLY serve trips going towards UPS.

\n

Trips towards Broad & Oregon will stop along Island & Enterprise Aves. at Island & Escort Aves., and Enterprise & Executive Aves.

\n

Route 68 Detour Map | PDF

\n

The Platt Bridge reconstruction work is expected to last for approximately 2 years. Route 68 Local service will remain on detour during this time; Express service will not be impacted by the detour.

\n\t\t\t

Trolley Service Returns Betw 63rd & Girard and Frankford & Delaware Aves

\n\t\t\t\t

Beginning Sunday, April 29, 2012

\n\t\t\t\t

Shuttle Bus Service Continues East of Frankford Ave

\n

With the completion of the initial phase of the PennDOT demolition work for the I-95 reconstruction project, trolley service will return on the Route 15 for the portion of the line operating between 63rd & Girard and Frankford & Delaware Avenues (Northern Liberties Loop)

\n

Customers wishing to travel east of Frankford Ave will board the connecting shuttle bus service at Front Street - by the Girard Ave stop on the Market Frankford Line

\n

Please check System Status for any up to the minute Route 15 service changes while this major construction project is completed

\n

I-95 Construction - Service Alteration | PDF

\n\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t

Service Detours

\n\t\t\t\t

Beginning Monday, June 4, 2012

\n\t\t\t\t

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

\n

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

\n

Service will operate around the construction with detours stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

\n

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

\n

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

\n

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour.

\n

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

\n

Summer Timetables go into effect on Sunday, June 17, 2012.

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

\n

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

\n

Service will operate around the construction with detours stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

\n

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

\n

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

\n

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour.

\n

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

\n

Summer Timetables go into effect on Sunday, June 17, 2012.

\n\t\t\t

\n\t\t\t\t

40th Street Bridge Reopening - Regular Route 38 & 40 Routing Resumes

\n\t\t\t\t

Effective Sunday, November 25, 2012

\n\t\t\t\t

With the re-opening of the 40th Street bridge over Amtrak, Route 38 and Route 40 service changes will be as follows:

\n

Route 38

\n

Route 38 will resume its regular routing via 40th Street.

\n

Route 38 Map | PDF

\n

Route 40

\n

Eastbound service will return to its regular routing via 40th Street.

\n

Westbound service will continue its present detour around the closed 41st Street bridge via Left on Mantua Avenue, Right on 42nd Street, Right on Girard Avenue and Left on 41st Street where it will resume its regular route.

\n

Route 40 Map | PDF

\n

We wish to thank you for your patience during this City of Philadelphia construction project; these changes are expected to reduce overall travel time and improve the on-time performance for these routes.

\n

Timetable maps on the SEPTA website will be revised to show the changes, however new paper timetables will not be issued until the February 17, 2013 schedule change.

Allows introspection of the SEPTA locations and routes, and provides basically-realtime data on delays, alerts, vehicles, and routes.
